content:
• Tuesday, January 9, 2018
  • FTK

    Flotek names new chief administrator, fires up new citrus oil unit

    • Flotek (NYSE:FTK) has named William York to the post of chief administrative officer.
    • He'll oversee human resources as well as IT, safety and administrative functions at the company, and report to CEO, President and Chairman John Chisholm.
    • York joins from Tudor Lewis, the executive search firm he founded; he has previous experience with TMP/Highland Partners and Bank of America.
    • The company also noted its new vacuum distillation unit is fully operational at its Winter Haven, Fla., facility.
    • That 20-drum custom unit will expand the company's citrus oil processing efficiency and capacity. It's got eight commercial distillation units dedicated to refining citrus oils.
    • Shares rose 4.1% during the regular session today.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:11 PM | 1 Comment

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: TSRI +35.0%. TNDM +22.0%. AFSI +21.0%. KODK +9.0%. SHLM +5.2%.
    • Top losers: ARRY -5.8%. FTFT -5.5%. XCRA -3.6%. CVI -3.4%. INFN -3.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 4 Comments
  • GWRE

    Guidewire announces CFO transition

    • Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE) announces that CFO Richard Hart will transition into a role as Chief Strategy Officer on or around March 6.
    • Curtis Smith will become the new CFO. Smith previously served in that role at Keynote Systems and Infusion Software. 
    • Guidewire shares are down 0.3% aftermarket.  
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • TSRI

    TSR reports Q2 results

    • TSR (NASDAQ:TSRI): Q2 EPS of $0.12
    • Revenue of $16.52M (+9.8% Y/Y)
    • Shares +35% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • NUAN

    Nuance's Dragon Drive powering new Toyota concept car

    • At CES, Nuance Communications (NASDAQ:NUAN) is leaning on new AI innovations targeted not only at the home experience but at its burgeoning automotive platform.
    • The company's Dragon Drive connected-car platform is behind the auto assistant in Toyota's Concept-i vehicle, also on show in Las Vegas.
    • It offers features including "voice-controlled restaurant and point of interest search, navigation, Q&A, sports information, and integration with content providers like HERE and Yelp."
    • Nuance also says it's working with Toyota's "emotion estimation engine" to account for user's attention and emotional reaction to deliver more intelligent conversational interfaces.
    • Dragon Drive is in more than 200M cars on the road today, Nuance says.
    • The company's also showcasing enhanced capabilities for Loop, its AI-powered marketing platform for mobile operators to connect users with new services (and revenue streams).
    • Shares rose 1.8% during the session today. The company is said to be looking at strategic options for the auto business.
    • #CES18
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM | 4 Comments
  • TNDM

    Tandem Diabetes Care sees strong 2017 finish, Q4 sales up over 35%; shares up 20% after hours

    • On a preliminary basis, Tandem Diabetes Care (NASDAQ:TNDM) expects Q4 2017 and full-year sales to be $39M - 40M (+37% from midpoint) and $106 - 107M (+26% from midpoint), respectively.
    • Pump shipments increased to ~7K (+58%) and 17.1K (+1%), respectively.
    • Preliminary 2018 guidance: Sales: $132M - 140M.
    • Final 2017 earnings will be released on Thursday, March 1 after the close.
    • Shares are up 20% after hours on robust volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 9 Comments
  • AFSI

    AmTrust backers make privatization proposal; shares up 6.4%

    • A group made up of Stone Point Capital, Chairman and CEO Barry Zyskind, and the Karfunkel family are offering $12.25 per share in cash for the stock they don't currently hold.
    • The group currently owns or controls about 43% of AmTrust (NASDAQ:AFSI).
    • A special committee of the board is expected to be formed to study the bid.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Shares +6.4% after hours to $10.80.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 63 Comments
  • VOXX

    VOXX International beats by $0.23, beats on revenue

    • VOXX International (NASDAQ:VOXX): Q3 EPS of $0.37 beats by $0.23.
    • Revenue of $156.56M (-0.5% Y/Y) beats by $5.56M.
    • Shares +3%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 37 Comments
  • SNX

    Synnex beats by $0.11, beats on revenue

    • Synnex (NYSE:SNX): Q4 EPS of $2.79 beats by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $5.31B (+36.5% Y/Y) beats by $450M.
    • Shares +2.2%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • JWN

    Nordstrom updates guidance

    • Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) reports holiday sales increased 2.5%.
    • Comparable sales were up 1.2% for the crucial two-month period.
    • Based on holiday results, Nordstrom says it sees FY17 sales growth of 4.2% and EPS of $2.90 to $2.95 vs. $2.99 consensus and $2.85 to $2.95 prior.
    • The company is scheduled to report full Q4 results on March 1.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • MTN

    Vail rallies on hopes for big MLK weekend

    • Vail Resorts (NYSE:MTN) closed with a 3.71% gain on strong volume after a weather forecast for "significant" mountain snow stirred up optimism that MLK weekend resort traffic could be high.
    • Snow accumualtions of 8 to 16 inches are forecast by the National Weather Service.
    • Reports on January traffic to date at Vail have been disappointing.
    • Sources: Bloomberg, National Weather Service
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 3 Comments
  • AKAM

    Bloomberg: Akamai pursuing strategic alternatives, sale

    • Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) is working with Morgan Stanley to explore strategic alternatives including a potential sale, according to Bloomberg sources.
    • The exploration comes after pressure from activist investor Elliott Management.  
    • Akamai shares are up 2.1%.  
    • Previously: Akamai +10.7% after active stake reveal (Dec. 15, 2017)
    • Previously: Craig-Hallum upgrades Akamai on activist investor (Dec. 19, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 2 Comments
  • DE

    Deere up another 3% after analyst meeting

    • Barclays' Adam Seiden was impressed, saying the stock continues to have room to run after a near-60% advance over the past year. The Wirtgen Group purchase last summer should allow construction margins to grow by 300-350 basis points in 2019.
    • Management was optimistic, says Blair's Lawrence De Maria, thanks to the implementation of structural cost savings and a flat to improved outlook for most markets this year.
    • Deere (DE +2.9%), he says, believes there's a new normal of $3.50 corn and $9.50 beans.
    • Source: Bloomberg's Esha Dey
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 4 Comments
  • BHC

    Valeant presentation at JPM18 set for tomorrow at 1:30 ET; shares up 3%

    • Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX +3.2%) chief Joseph Papa will deliver a corporate overview at JPM18 tomorrow, January 10, at 1:30 pm ET (10:30 am PT). Key points:
    • Company turnaround and reignition of growth to be driven by resolving legacy issues, de-risking the balance sheet, investing in core franchises with attractive growth and launching new products with meaningful opportunities.
    • Dermatology turnaround to be driven by new products. FDA action date for topical psoriasis med DUOBRII (IDP-118) June 18. Derm salesforce to be increased 25%, focus on psoriasis. U.S. marketing applications for ALTRENO (IDP-121) for acne (October 2017) and JEMDEL (IDP-122) for psoriasis (December 2017) filed.
    • February 13 FDA action date for PLENVU (NER1006) bowel prep marketing application.
    • Cash flow from operations was $1.712B for first three quarters of 2017. Total debt reduced by more than $6.5B since Q1 2016.
    • #JPM18
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 38 Comments

  • FOGO

    Credit Suisse updates on Fogo De Chao

    • Credit Suisse posts an update on Neutral-rated Fogo De Chao (FOGO +1.5%) after meeting with management at ICR.
    • "Mgmt. cited initiatives such as day part expansion, new bar menus, remodels and a more favorable holiday calendar for the improved sales," reports the analyst team.
    • "We came away from the meeting more optimistic that FOGO can deliver EBITDA and EPS growth in 2018, with the latter helped by tax reform (mgmt. estimates ~21-25% tax rate post-reform)."
    • Credit Suisse raises its price target to $14 from $11.50.
    • Previously: ICR: Fogo de Chao sees growing U.S. store base 10% (Jan. 8)
    • #ICR18
     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • WTW

    Oprah squeeze at Weight Watchers

    • Talk of an Oprah Winfrey run in the 2020 Presidential election has done a number on shorts hoping for weakness in shares of Weight Watchers (WTW +6.9%), observes S3 Partners analyst Ihor Dusaniwky.
    • "WTW short interest peaked in mid-August 2017 at $443 million and after hitting a yearly low of $208 million in September short sellers began to gradually accumulate short exposure. Short interest has remained relatively stable over the last several months, trading at a range between $300 million and $400 million," writes Dusaniwsky
    • Shares of WTW are up around 20% over the last two days and carved out a new 52-week high of $57.13 earlier.
    • Previously: Weight Watchers +10% after Oprah jolt (Jan. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 26 Comments
  • NKTR

    Nektar up 9% ahead of JPM18 presentation

    • Nektar Therapeutics (NKTR +8.5%) heads north, albeit on low volume, ahead of a presentation this morning at 11:00 am PT by CEO Howard Robin at JPM18.
    • Shares have rallied almost 180% since early November when the company announced positive data on NKTR-214 and NKTR-358.
    • Previously: Nektar Therapeutics up 25% premarket on encouraging preclinical data on immune system stimulator NKTR-214 (Nov. 13, 2017)
    • Previously: Preclinical data show encouraging action for Nektar's immune system balancer NKTR-358; shares ahead 5% (Nov. 7, 2017)
    • #JPM18
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble drifts to 20-year low

    • Barnes & Noble (BKS -6.8%) fell to more than a twenty-year low of $4.95 earlier today before pushing back over $5.00.
    • Sentiment on the retailer continues to be very weak since its disappointing update on holiday sales.
    • On the bright side, the enterprise value on B&N is said to be attractive now to a private equity buyer.
    • Previously: Painful drop for Barnes & Noble (Jan. 5)
    • Previously: Barnes & Noble misses out on early rush for 'Fire and Fury' (Jan. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 10 Comments
  • RPT

    Another tough year ahead for strip malls

    • "It's difficult to get bullish," on strip malls, says Boenning & Scattergood's Floris van Dijkum.
    • He sees strip mall players' earnings sliding 2% this year, and has Underperform ratings on Ramco-Gershenson Trust (RPT -3%), DDR (DDR -2.4%), and Cedar Realty (CDR -2.5%).
    • Van Dijkum expects better performance from malls and hotels.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: REITs roughed-up as rates break out; utilities too (Jan. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • O

    REITs roughed-up as rates break out; utilities too

    • The bear market in bonds was confirmed today,  says Bill Gross, reacting to new cycle highs in 5- and 10-year Treasury yields.
    • Income favorites like REITs (IYR -0.8%) and utilities (XLU -0.9%) are selling off thanks to the boosted competition. The major averages, in the meantime, are all in the green.
    • Realty Income (O -0.9%), Omega Healthcare (OHI -1.6%), HCP (HCP -1.3%), Vereit (VER -0.6%), Equity Residential (EQR -1.4%), Simon Property (SPG -1.6%), Kimco (KIM -2.7%), Extra Space Storage (EXR -1.2%), Boston Properties (BXP -1%), Pebblebrook Hotel (PEB -1.3%), Select Income REIT (SIR -1%)
    • ETFs: VNQ, IYR, XLU, UTG, RQI, VPU, SCHH, RNP, RFI, GUT, IDU, KBWY, DRN, BUI, NRO, URE, ICF, XLRE, JRS, RWR, SRS, FUTY, FREL, DRA, DRV, RIF
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 135 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: MMAC +20%. JP +10%.LMFA +7%. UCBI +6%. CARV +6%.
    • Losers: SGLB -11%. HGSH -8%. OAKS -6%. BRG -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • IBM

    IBM tops list of U.S. patents for 25th year

    • IBM (NYSE:IBM) received a record 9,043 patents in 2017, which made the company number one in U.S. patent assignments for the 25th year.
    • Analytics firm IFI Claims released its annual list of rankings and Samsung came second with 3,300 fewer patents than IBM.
    • Other members of the top 10: Canon, Intel, LG Electronics, Qualcomm, Google, Microsoft, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company.
    • IBM’s patents included 1,900 for cloud-related tech, 1,400 for AI, and 1,200 for cybersecurity.
    • IBM has now surpassed 100,000 U.S. patents issued from 1993 to 2017.
    • IBM shares are up 0.5%.
    • Previously: Axios: Aspen Institute launching cybersecurity initiative with IBM, politicians, academics (Jan. 5)
    • Correction: Post updated to correct the number of AI patents.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM | 22 Comments
  • DRRX

    Durect up 11% on Pain Therapeutics' Remoxy-stoked rally

    • DURECT (DRRX +10.8%) jumps on triple normal volume in conjunction with the rally in Pain Therapeutics (PTIE +144.5%) after the latter reported positive results from a nasal abuse potential study for REMOXY ER (extended-release oxycodone capsules CII) which will support the resubmission of its U.S. marketing application.
    • REMOXY incorporates DURECT's ORADUR abuse-deterrent technology, licensed to Pain in December 2002. Under the terms of the agreement, DURECT is eligible to receive royalties of 6.0 - 11.5% on net sales in addition to a mark-up on certain excipients used in manufacturing.
    • Previously: Pain Therapeutic's abuse-deterrent Remoxy successful in nasal abuse potential study; shares ahead 12% premarket (Jan. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM | 1 Comment

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: PTIE +143%. DFFN +39%. KODK +31%. KEN +27%. CGG-OLD +24%. ITUS +21%. ALDR +20%. MMAC +19%. GBT +18%. ABAX +17%.
    • Losers: AMMA-OLD -43%. OTC:ARDM -37%. AXSM -36%. MYSZ -28%. APHB -19%. DELT -19%. BGFV -17%. QTNT -16%. EXPR -16%. BLPH -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • SNE

    Sony unveils Google Assistant-enabled headphones, new and old

    • Sony (NYSE:SNE) announces two new headphone styles that come with Google (GOOG, GOOGL) Assistant capabilities. The company also plans to add Assistant to some older headphones retroactively.
    • Flagship WF-SP700N will sell for $179.99. The Bluetooth headphones have a sleek, pill-shaped design and feature noise cancelation, Ambient Mode, and up to three hours of play on one charge. 
    • The bulkier WI-SP600N headphones will sell for $149.99. The model has noise cancellation features and six hours of battery life via USB cord. 
    • Software updates will bring Assistant to five older models, including the predecessors to the newly announced headphones.   
    • Sony shares are up 1.1%.   
    • #CES18 
    • Previously: Google releases Home sales info, CES Assistant focus (Jan. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 8 Comments
  • KODK

    Old school Kodak +67% on blockchain move

    • Eastman Kodak (NYSE:KODK) spikes 67% after announcing a crypto move.
    • Kodak and WENN Digital say they are launching a KODAKOne image rights management platform and a cryptocurrency called KODAKCoin to help empower photographers and agencies to take greater control in image rights management.
    • Kodak says the new system will utilize blockchain technology to create an encrypted, digital ledger of rights ownership for photographers.
    • It's a big step from its roots for Eastman Kodak, which was a Dow Jones constituent from 1930 to 2004.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 56 Comments
  • ARDM

    Aradigm plummets 37% ahead of Ad Com review of Linhaliq

    • Aradigm (OTC:ARDM -36.5%) is getting roughed up after briefing docs were released ahead of Thursday's advisory committee review on inhaled ciprofloxacin for non-cystic fibrosis bronchiectasis, an Orphan Drug, Fast Track and Qualified Infectious Disease indication.
    • Investors are clearly signaling that they do not expect a positive vote. In the FDA briefing doc, the results from the two pivotal studies, ORBIT-3 and ORBIT-4 are reviewed.
    • ORBIT-3 failed to demonstrate a treatment effect for Cipro while ORBIT-4 did. The FDA reviewers note that the reasons for the different outcomes cannot be determined based on the information collected in the two studies which prevents excluding bias in the results. The reviewers also question (page 32) the validity of the "time to first exacerbation" endpoint (over a year compared to placebo) since it is "unclear" that it translates into a "clinically meaningful benefit." They also question the duration of the studies saying they may not have been long enough to demonstrate whether Cipro reduced the frequency of exacerbations to a clinically meaningful extent and if the effect is durable beyond a year considering the potential increase in safety signals and bacterial resistance from long-term exposure.
    • The FDA's action date for the application is January 26.
    • Previously: Aradigm down 8% premarket ahead of Ad Com review of inhaled ciprofloxacin for chronic non-CF lung infection (Jan. 9)
    • Previously: Aradigm's ciprofloxacin shows mixed results in two late-stage studies; shares down 60% premarket (Dec. 1, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 8 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: ONP +8%. SUP +6%. NBEV +6%. KBSF +6%.
    • Losers: ELF -14%. OTIV -7%. SPWH -6%. VUZI -6%. WKHS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • XSPA

    XpresSpa opens off-airport prototype location in WTC area

    • XpresSpa (XSPA -9.9%) -- newly named from its old FORM Holdings -- is opening its latest location as an off-airport prototype.
    • The new spa is located at the Westfield World Trade Center in downtown New York's "Oculus" complex.
    • That spa is located in Manhattan's biggest mall and at its third-largest transport hub, seeing 300,000 daily commuters along with 15M annual global travelers.
    • The prototype provides the company a valuable look at "potential to materially expand our addressable market" beyond airport locations, says President Ed Jankowski.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • BRPHF

    Novogratz's crypto plan comes into focus

    • via Erik Schatzker at Bloomberg
    • The former Goldman partner wants to build the Goldman Sachs of crypto, according to a source. In a filing today, he's laid out a series of steps to raise $200M and take his Galaxy vehicle public on Canada's TSX Venture Exchange.
    • The crypto merchant bank will be involved with trading, principal investing, asset management, and advisory work.
    • Step one will be the purchase of Canadian crypto startup First Coin Capital. Next will be a reverse takeover of Canadian shell Bradmer Pharmaceuticals (OTC:BRPHF). That entity would then look to raise C$250M ($201M) in a private placement next month, and be renamed Galaxy Digital Holdings.
    • Novogratz plans to put nearly all of his crypto investments into Galaxy - roughly $400M of Bitcoin, Ether, and ICO stakes, as well as positions in blockchain-related startups.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, OTCPK:BTLLF SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:UBIA, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, PRELF, OTCPK:BLKCF, OTC:CRCW, COINB, OTCPK:LFIN
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 29 Comments
  • AYI

    Post-earnings slide for Acuity Brands

    • Acuity Brands (AYI -12.1%) is sharply lower after missing FQ1 estimates by a wide margin (sales $843M vs. $873M expected, EPS $1.94 vs. $2.09 expected) with its preliminary report.
    • Adjusted operating margin was 15.9% of sales vs. 16.8% a year ago.
    • Shares are down to a three-week low.
    • Previously: Acuity Brands misses by $0.16, misses on revenue (Jan. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • FTNT

    Fortinet -1.6% on analyst downgrade

    • Barclays downgrades Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) from Overweight to Equal Weight.
    • Analyst Saket Kalia cites tougher firewall market competition and an industry-wide deceleration that’s taking revenue growth to the mid-single digits. 
    • Kalia notes peers like Palo Alto have a better advantage due to market share improvement, a refresh cycle, and optionality. 
    • The analyst does clarify that Fortinet “is not an expensive stock” and that the firm “can be wrong if more consistent results lead to multiple re-rating.” 
    • Fortinet shares are down 1.6%.        
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • MTBC

    MTBC up 5% on 2017 results

    • Nano cap Medical Transcription Billing (MTBC +4.7%) is up on modestly higher volume on the heels of the release of preliminary 2017 results. Highlights:
    • Full-year revenue was ~$31.8M (+30%). Non-GAAP EBITDA was ~$2M compared to loss of ($0.6M) a year ago. Cash balance at year-end was ~$4.4M.
    • Final results will be announced in early March. Management will host an earnings call on Wednesday, March 7, at 8:30 am ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 2 Comments

    • Gainers: PTIE +126%. DFFN +38%. CANF +19%. GBT +18%. ABAX +16%.
    • Losers: OTC:ARDM -43%. AXSM -36%. QTNT -15%. APHB -11%. BLPH -10%.

  • GBT

    Global Blood's voxelotor a Breakthrough Therapy for sickle cell disease; shares ahead 19%

    • The FDA designates Global Blood Therapeutics' (GBT +19.2%) lead candidate voxelotor a Breakthrough Therapy for the treatment of sickle cell disease. It also has PRIME status in Europe.
    • Breakthrough Therapy status provides for more intensive guidance from the FDA on development, the involvement of more senior agency personnel and a rolling review of the marketing application.
    • Voxelotor is an oral once-daily therapy that works by increasing hemoglobin's affinity for oxygen.
    • Previously: Global Blood's late-stage study of SCD candidate voxelotor to continue as planned, enrollment expanded to adolescents; shares ahead 2% premarket (Nov. 13, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 5 Comments
  • JACK

    Jack in the Box issues guidance at ICR

    • Jack in the Box (JACK +1.2%) expects same-store sales to increase 1% to 2% this year, according to the company's ICR presentation.
    • The restaurant operator also guides for FY18 EBITDA of $260M to $270M and an EBITDA margin rate of +30%.
    • Share  buybacks of ~$200M are expected in the back half of the year.
    • Jack in the Box ICR presentation webcast
    • #ICR18
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • DFFN

    Diffusion Pharma up 39% after Biotech Showcase presentation

    • Thinly traded nano cap Diffusion Pharmaceuticals (DFFN +38.8%) is up on a healthy 32x surge in volume. After the close yesterday, CEO David Kalergis delivered a corporate overview at the 10th Annual Biotech Showcase in San Francisco that clearly pleased investors.
    • The company has yet to post the presentation on its website, but a key recent event was the start of a Phase 3 clinical trial assessing lead candidate trans sodium crocetinate (TSC) in newly diagnosed patients with inoperable glioblastoma multiforme, the most common and aggressive form of brain tumor.
    • Orphan Drug-tagged TSC is a small molecule that modifies the tumor microenvironment which improves the effectiveness of radiation therapy and chemotherapy.
    • Previously: FDA signs off on Phase 3 protocol for Diffusion Pharma's lead candidate TSC; shares ahead 75% premarket (Oct. 17, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • AEO

    Mall sector jittery as ICR rolls on

    • Retail chains American Eagle Outfitters (AEO -4.3%), Urban Outfitters (URBN -5.8%) and Express (EXPR -13.6%) all trade lower after missing sales expectations for the two-month holiday period.
    • AEO and Urban posted positive comparable sales growth, but Express expects to report a negative comp.
    • Investors have their eyes glued to the sector today with the ICR Conference running at full tilt (see updates). Trading weak on the day are New York & Company (NWY -8.7%), Citi Trends (CTRN -6.1%), Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -4.2%), L Brands (LB -2.7%), Gap (GPS -1.6%), Chico's FAS (CHS -3.3%), Guess (GES -2.2%) and Buckle (BKE -4.6%).
    • #ICR18
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 5 Comments
  • ILMN

    Illumina expects strong finish for 2017 with Q4 sales up 25%; shares ahead 6%

    • Illumina (ILMN +5.8%) is up in early trading on increased volume on the heels of the release of its JPM18 presentation that will be delivered this afternoon at 3:30 pm PT.
    • Q4 sales should be ~$775M (+25%) while full-year revenue should be ~$2.75B (+15%).
    • Installed based of instruments now exceeds 11,000. ~285 NovaSeq units shipped.
    • 2018 guidance: total revenues: ~$3.12B (+13%); EPS: $4.14 - 4.24; non-GAAP EPS: $4.50 - 4.60.
    • #JPM18
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 6 Comments
  • STX

    Analysts up Seagate price target on prelim Q2, crypto ties

    • Analysts increase Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) price targets following yesterday’s preliminary Q2 results and reveal of the company’s cryptocurrency ties.
    • Loop Capital raises its Seagate price target by $5 to $55 and maintains Buy rating.
    • Analyst Ananda Baruah says Q2 prelim increases confidence the company can eventually top 32% gross margin. Baruah was less decided on how to value Seagate’s Ripple stake since coin market cap doesn’t equal equity market cap.
    • Cowen raises its Seagate target from $39 to $47 and rates it Market Perform.
    • Analyst Karl Ackerman says the prelim results show the company is executing in HDDs “exceptionally well” while the recent NAND supply agreement with Toshiba bolsters that side of the business.
    • Morgan Stanley raises its Seagate target by $3 to $40 citing expected cloud demand growth in 1H18 and tailwinds from Q2 near-line storage market share gains.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
    • Seagate shares are up 1.5%. 
    • Previously: Analysts put Seagate's crypto stake at 2% to 3% (Jan. 8)
    • Previously: Seagate releases preliminary Q2 results (Jan. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 4 Comments
  • FIT

    Bloomberg: Fitbit eyes making smartwatch for children

  • PTIE

    Pain Therapeutic's abuse-deterrent Remoxy successful in nasal abuse potential study; shares ahead 12% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Pain Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PTIE) is up 12% premarket on light volume on the heels of its announcement of positive results from a nasal abuse potential study assessing REMOXY ER (extended-release oxycodone capsules CII), its abuse-deterrent formulation of the commonly prescribed opioid pain med.
    • The results showed that non-dependent recreational opioid users who snorted the drug reported reduced drug liking compared to immediate-release oxycodone. The data also showed that nasal administration of REMOXY ER resulted in lower exposure to oxycodone, lower peak concentrations and longer time to peak drug concentration than comparator drugs.
    • The company says it plans to resubmit its U.S. marketing application shortly.

  • AXSM

    Axsome's AXS-02 fails to show treatment effect in late-stage regional pain syndrome study; shares down 23% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap Axsome Therapeutics (NASDAQ:AXSM) slumps 23% premarket on light volume on the heels of its announcement that the independent data monitoring committee (DMC) has recommended the termination of the Phase 3 CREATE-1 study assessing co-lead candidate AXS-02 in patients with complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS), a chronic pain condition affecting a limb usually after an injury, due to futility (unlikely to demonstrate a treatment benefit).
    • CREATE-1 randomized CRPS patients to receive either AXS-02 or placebo once per week for six weeks. The primary endpoint was the change in weekly average daily pain intensity on a 0-10 scale at week 12.
    • The DMC recommended the continuation of another Phase 3, COAST-1, assessing AXS-02 in knee osteoarthritis associated with bone marrow lesions.
    • AXS-02 (disodium zoledronate tetrahydrate) is an orally administered non-opioid pain therapeutic that inhibits bone turnover and localizes to regions of increased turnover (lesions in the bone marrow). It works by inhibiting an enzyme called farnesyl pyrophosphate synthase which, in turn, reduces the activity of bone cells called osteoclasts, cells that break down bone tissue in the critical process of bone regeneration.
    • Management will host a conference call momentarily to discuss the data.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM | 6 Comments

  • PSTI

    FDA signs off on Pluristem's EAP for PLX-PAD cells in critical limb ischemia; shares up 20% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap Pluristem Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTI) is up 20% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement that the FDA has cleared its Expanded Access Program (EAP) for the use of its PLX-PAD cell treatment in patients with critical limb ischemia (CLI).
    • EAP allows the use of an investigational therapy outside of clinical trials in situations where patients are unsuitable for inclusion in the studies and their condition is life-threatening with no realistic treatment options. CLI is an advanced stage of peripheral artery disease that frequently requires amputation of the limbs and has high mortality risk.
    • PLX-PAD cell therapy utilizes placental cells to secrete therapeutic proteins that trigger the body's own repair mechanisms which allows it to grow blood vessels and deliver oxygenated blood to damaged tissue, thereby accelerating the healing process.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 AM | 3 Comments

  • ILMN

    Illumina to sell Fisher's Ion AmpliSeq technology

    • Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN) inks an agreement with Thermo Fisher Scientific (NYSE:TMO) enabling it to sell the latter's Ion AmpliSeq technology to researchers conducting studies on its next-generation sequencing (NGS) platforms. The amplicon technology is highly effective in capturing DNA and RNA from minute samples in a range of research areas.
    • Illumina will sell the product directly to researchers under the brand name AmpliSeq. Fisher will continue to market AmpliSeq chemistry for both research use and in vitro diagnostic use to Ion Torrent NGS customers and retains the right to make the technology available on other NGS platforms.
    • Financial terms are not disclosed.
